title: Region defined by exp. and quartic functions part - a

content.description: Let f and g be the functions defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>âˆ’</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGMbWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadIhaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacqGH9aqp caaIXaGaey4kaSIaamiEaiabgUcaRiaadwgapaWaaWbaaSqabeaape GaamiEa8aadaahaaadbeqaa8qacaaIYaaaaSGaeyOeI0IaaGOmaiaa dIhaaaaaaa@4415@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> and g(x)=x4-6.5x2+6x+2. Let R and S be the two regions enclosed by the graphs of f and g shown in the figure above.
content.question: Find the sum of the areas of regions R and S.

frqParts.text: Find the sum of the areas of regions R and S.

topic.text: 8.6: Finding the Area Between Curves That Intersect at More Than Two Points
